question: 阻む
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>thwart</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to thwart</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to hamper</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: Someone walks up to you, saying "<reading>habbah</reading> habbah habbah" (kind of like hubbah hubbah). He's trying to flash you or something. So, you go <vocabulary>to thwart</vocabulary> him with your taser.
